body: CITY kids are known for being tough and jaded, overstimulated and overscheduled. For good reason. While so many of their ancestors came here to give them a better life, it requires as much grit and courage to grow up in New York as it does to immigrate. But children simply aim their zany imaginations and raw perceptions at what they know. So the
title: Hello Up There

body: NEW YORK BROOKLYN: POSSIBLE ANTI-SEMITIC VANDALISM Since the Jewish holiday of Sukkot began last Friday, the police have reported seven cases of vandalism to sukkahs, the huts that Jews erect to commemorate the harvest festival. The police are referring the vandalism cases, all in Brooklyn, to the hate crimes task force. Yesterday, a 12-year-old
title: METRO BRIEFING

body: NEW YORK FARMINGVILLE: WORKERS BEATEN -- Two migrant workers were attacked with shovels and knives Sunday morning by two men posing as contractors, the police said. Two white men in Farmingville lured the Mexican men into their station wagon with the promise of work. The workers were driven to an abandoned building in Shirley, N.Y., said Detective
title: METRO BRIEFING

body: INTERNATIONAL A2-6 Barak Sees Bleak Future Without Peace Settlement Prime Minister Ehud Barak warned of ''a tragedy'' ahead for Israel and the Palestinians if they failed to reach a peace pact, and he hinted that he feared a return to the Islamic terrorist attacks of the sort that killed scores in the mid-1990's. A6 White House officials said
title: NEWS SUMMARY

body: A 17-year-old was arrested yesterday afternoon and accused of igniting a Brooklyn stable fire in June that killed 21 horses and sent 30-foot flames soaring into the night sky, the police said. The suspect, Frank Esposito, was charged with arson, reckless endangerment, 21 counts of animal cruelty, and marijuana possession, the police said, adding
title: 17-Year-Old Is Charged In Fire at Brooklyn Stable

body: Thirty-two horses burned to death yesterday in a barn fire in northern Westchester County, the police said. The barn, at Breakaway Farms, a boarding stable in North Salem, caught fire around 5:15 a.m. and quickly burned to the ground with the horses trapped inside, said Trooper Thomas Libretti of the State Police barracks in Somers. The fire is
title: 32 Horses Are Killed In Westchester Fire

body: Fire officials yesterday were investigating the cause of a fire that gutted the Bergen Beach Stables, a century-old horse barn in the Mill Basin section of Brooklyn, killing 21 horses. The two-alarm fire broke out shortly before midnight Friday, engulfing the wooden, 46-stall barn at 1364 East 66th Street in 30-foot flames. Fire officials said 121
title: Brooklyn Stable Fire Kills 21 Horses Trapped in Stalls

body: At least nine horses died last night when a fire broke out in a Brooklyn stable, fire officials said. Vito Berretta, a fire department spokesman, said the roof of Bergen Beach Stables, a wood-frame building at 1364 E. 66th Street near Avenue N in Bergen Beach, collapsed during the fire. He said nine horses were confirmed dead, and at least four
title: 9 Horses Die in Fire In Brooklyn Stable

body: By 8:30 on Saturday morning, more than 100 would-be candidates had already gathered in a Manhattan conference room to ponder what shape their lives would take if they were to find themselves elected to the City Council next year. By 9 a.m., custodians were forced to bring out more chairs to accommodate the throng of latecomers. They had come from
title: Big Dreams for Wide Open Council Seats

body: To the Editor: In response to ''Pull Over, Somehow'' (F.Y.I., Jan. 9), perhaps you ought to follow up on the issue of the credibility of the ambulance drivers. It has been my experience in Brooklyn that an ambulance, not on call and rolling with the traffic, will pull out of lane and put on the lights and sirens merely to pass a red light. Having
title: Ambulances Run Lights, Even on Routine Trips
